branch_point.content:
# pips_puzzle.yaml

pips:
  pip_min: 0
  pip_max: 6

dominoes:
  unique: true
  tiles:
    # Fill with the full multiset from the tray, e.g.
    # - [6,1]
    # - [6,2]
    # - [6,0]
    # - [6,3]
    # - [6,4]
    # - [5,3]
    # - [2,2]
    # - [2,1]
    # - [1,0]
    # - [1,3]
    # - [0,4]
    # - [3,4]
    # - [4,4]
    # - [4,2]
    # - [3,3]


    # IMPORTANT: order doesn't matter
    - [6,1]
    - [6,2]
    - [6,0]
    - [6,3]
    - [6,4]
    - [5,3]
    - [2,2]
    - [2,1]
    - [1,0]
    - [1,3]
    - [0,4]
    - [3,4]
    - [4,4]
    - [4,2]
    - [3,3]

board:
  # '.' = cell exists, '#' = no cell
  shape: |
    ##....####
    ##....####
    ....###..#
    ....##..##
    ##..###.##
    ##..###.##
    ##..######
    ##..######
  # same dimensions as shape, but each '.' becomes a region label
  # Put '#' where there is no cell.
  regions: |
    ##BBCC####
    ##HGFD####
    AAHG###MN#
    EEEI##OM##
    ##EI###M##
    ##LJ###M##
    ##KJ######
    ##KJ######

region_constraints:
  # Each key is a region label used above.
  # type can be: sum, all_equal
  # For sum: op one of: "==", "!=", "<", ">"
  A: { type: sum, op: "==", value: 12 }
  B: { type: sum, op: "<",  value: 2 }
  C: { type: sum, op: "==", value: 10 }
  D: { type: sum, op: ">",  value: 2 }
  E: { type: all_equal }
  F: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 2 }
  G: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 2 }
  H: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 6 }
  I: { type: sum, op: "==", value: 12 }
  J: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 6 }
  K: { type: all_equal }
  L: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 2 }
  M: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 4 }
  N: { type: sum, op: "==",  value: 4 }
  O: { type: sum, op: ">",  value: 4 }
  # ...continue for all region labels you use

task_intent.title: 005-add-image-stats-diagnostic-endpoint
task_intent.description: Create a _calculate_image_stats function and expose it as a standalone API endpoint that returns brightness, contrast, dynamic range, color balance, and saturation metrics without requiring preprocessing. This helps users diagnose image quality issues before extraction.
